definitions.definition: To pledge; to assert, assure; to dare say.
To take by trickery; to trap, to seize upon.
To assume, as a character; to take on.
To engage with; to attack, take on in a fight.
To have knowledge of; to hear.
To have or take charge of.
A facility where eggs are hatched under artificial conditions, especially those of fish or poultry.
The act of judging.
The power or faculty of performing such operations; especially, when unqualified, the faculty of judging or deciding rightly, justly, or wisely
definitions.example: a man of judgment

definitions.definition: The conclusion or result of judging; an opinion; a decision.
The act of determining, as in courts of law, what is conformable to law and justice; also, the determination, decision, or sentence of a court, or of a judge.
The final award; the last sentence.
A prom (dance).
A walk taken for pleasure, display, or exercise; a stroll.
A place where one takes a walk for leisurely pleasure, or for exercise, especially a terrace by the seaside.
A dance motion consisting of a walk, done while square dancing.
To walk for amusement, show, or exercise.
To perform the stylized walk of a square dance.
The point of complete depletion, of the state of being used up.
definitions.example: We worked the mine to exhaustion, there's nothing left to extract.

definitions.definition: Supreme tiredness; having exhausted energy.
definitions.example: I ran in the marathon to exhaustion, then I collapsed and had to be carried away.

definitions.definition: The removal (by percolation etc) of an active medicinal constituent from plant material.
The removal of all air from a vessel (the creation of a vacuum).
An exhaustive procedure
A single unborn offspring at any stage of gestation.
Unborn offspring collectively.
definitions.example: Inheritance law allows property to be left to the unborn.

definitions.definition: Not yet born; yet to come; future.
Not yet delivered; still existing in the mother's womb.
Existing without birth or beginning.
